verses.text: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

similars.text: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.
I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.

verses.text: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

similars.text: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

verses.text: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

similars.text: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.
Withal praying also for us, that God would open unto us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:
I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
For the fulness of mine intent is that I may persuade men to come unto the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, and be saved.
O that I were an angel, and could have the wish of mine heart, that I might go forth and speak with the trump of God, with a voice to shake the earth, and cry repentance unto every people!

verses.text: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

similars.text: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to the grave in peace.
The Lord shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
And it is expedient that thou shouldst hold thy peace concerning them, and not teach them until ye have received them in full.
Keep my commandments; hold your peace; appeal unto my Spirit;

verses.text: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

similars.text: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence which I make now unto you.
If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

verses.text: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?

similars.text: These things I say not of myself; therefore, as the Lord speaketh, he will also fulfil.
With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the Lord shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?
Thou givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

verses.text: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

similars.text: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.

verses.text: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?
He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

similars.text: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

verses.text: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?

similars.text: Thou shalt not rule over him with rigour; but shalt fear thy God.
Sanctify the Lord of Hosts himself, and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.
Sanctify the Lord of hosts himself; and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.
But it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he prolong his days, which are as a shadow; because he feareth not before God.
The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe.
Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the Lord thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
Praise ye the Lord. Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.
Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.

verses.text: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.

similars.text: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.
Leave judgment alone with me, for it is mine and I will repay. Peace be with you; my blessings continue with you.
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.

verses.text: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

similars.text: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

verses.text: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

similars.text: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
Seest thou how Ahab humbleth himself before me? because he humbleth himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days: but in his son's days will I bring the evil upon his house.
Wilt thou yet say before him that slayeth thee, I am God? but thou shalt be a man, and no God, in the hand of him that slayeth thee.
In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

verses.text: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

similars.text: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
These things I say not of myself; therefore, as the Lord speaketh, he will also fulfil.
So likewise, whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath, he cannot be my disciple.
I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee:
And he that will not take up his cross and follow me, and keep my commandments, the same shall not be saved.
Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the Lord, and he shall save thee.
I will call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
And he shall say: I am he who spake in righteousness, mighty to save.

verses.text: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

similars.text: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
And the day cometh that you shall hear my voice and see me, and know that I am.
I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
Wherefore, you can testify that you have heard my voice, and know my words.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
Rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.
Verily, verily, I say unto you who now hear my words, which are my voice, blessed are ye inasmuch as you receive these things;
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
O hearken, ye elders of my church, and give ear to the words which I shall speak unto you.
Give ear to my words, O Lord, consider my meditation.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
Hearken, O ye people of my church, and ye elders listen together, and hear my voice while it is called today, and harden not your hearts;
Give ear, O Lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.

verses.text: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.

similars.text: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

verses.text: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

similars.text: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:
These things I say not of myself; therefore, as the Lord speaketh, he will also fulfil.
For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,

verses.text: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

similars.text: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:
Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.
Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

verses.text: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

similars.text: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and shew thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.
I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
Then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.
Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
And thou shalt speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.

verses.text: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.

similars.text: For our transgressions are multiplied before thee, and our sins testify against us: for our transgressions are with us; and as for our iniquities, we know them;
I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the Lord; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.
For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
That thou inquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?

verses.text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

similars.text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
And I will set my face against you, and ye shall be slain before your enemies: they that hate you shall reign over you; and ye shall flee when none pursueth you.
Deliver me, O Lord, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.
Lord, why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?
Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.
Lord, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
Hear me speedily, O Lord: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

verses.text: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

similars.text: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity.
Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness, because it is bitter, because it reacheth unto thine heart.
Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

verses.text: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.

similars.text: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

verses.text: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.

similars.text: For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool. But my righteousness shall be forever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
